Ad Text:

Our client is a market leading ASX retailer.

To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact William Harris on 0466 534 114.

Finance Planning and Analysis Manager / Business Reporting Manager

Corporate

UGL provides engineering, construction, and maintenance services across industries including rail, transport, telecommunications, oil and gas, power, renewables, resources, water, and defence in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.

About the role

We‚Äôre seeking an experienced Finance Planning and Analysis Manager (Business Reporting Manager) to join our corporate finance team, based in North Sydney. Reporting to the EGM, Finance, this role is critical in annual budget consolidation and month-end and statutory reporting across 20 budget owners and numerous cost centres. You will lead budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting processes to deliver clear, actionable insights that directly shape business decisions at the highest levels.

Why this role?

Step into a high-impact finance role at the core of our corporate head office operations.

Support decision-making by delivering accurate, relevant insights to the EGM, CFO, and CIMIC Group Reporting.

Manage over 40 key reports monthly, and play a critical role in managing project revenue, WIP analysis, and contractor finances.

Streamline processes, enhance reporting quality, and improve collaboration across operational finance teams.

Key responsibilities

Manage consolidated monthly and quarterly financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting using SAP and OneStream.

Lead consolidated project and WIH reporting, overhead reporting, profit & loss statements, balance sheets, cashflow, and detailed variance analysis, including reconciliation and analysis.

Prepare and deliver financial insights for senior stakeholders and parent entities.

Lead and develop a high-performing team of 3, fostering collaboration and process efficiency.

Contribute to strategic business initiatives by delivering actionable insights and recommendations.

What we offer

Enjoy a hybrid work arrangement working from home 1-2 days per week.
Benefit from 16 weeks of paid primary parental leave.
Complimentary salary continuance insurance.
Discounted Medibank health insurance.
Shape your career with an Individual Development Plan.
Participate in our Wellness Program with AIA Vitality.
Access our OneRewards Discount Program.

About you

Experience in a FPA Manager or similar role, with a background in infrastructure construction, engineering, or similar industry.

Expertise in project revenue recognition, contract types (design and construct, lump sum), subcontractor management, work in progress reporting, and billing profiles.

Advanced skills in SAP, OneStream, and Excel to generate forecasts, CAPEX analysis, detailed variance reports, and automate reports.

Skilled at translating data into clear, actionable insights, spotting trends, highlighting inefficiencies, and uncovering opportunities that drive real business outcomes.

Detail oriented ensuring reports are accurate, well-formatted and complete, and tailored to senior stakeholders and adept at streamlining processes, embedding efficiencies and delivering insights that often answer questions before they‚Äôre asked.

Join us to lead with precision, drive attention to detail, and inspire a culture of excellence across the team and organisation. Please include a cover letter with your application outlining your suitability for the role.

About Us

UGL is a respected of end-to-end engineering, construction, operation and maintenance services within various sectors including rail, transport, communications, oil and gas, power, renewables, resources, water and defence. We partner with some of the world‚Äôs largest blue-chip companies, government agencies, private enterprises, and public institutions. As a member of the CIMIC Group of companies, we value diversity in our team‚Äôs backgrounds, ideas, work styles.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage applications from people with disabilities, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people, mature aged workers and individuals from culturally diverse backgrounds.

Please note that relevant screening checks will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. These may include a national criminal history check and for you to complete a pre-employment medical questionnaire.

Ad Text:
About the role

Health Equity

It is expected that all Metro North Health staff, including the incumbent of this role as a valuable member of the Metro North workforce, contribute to the health equity agenda and meet the intent of supporting the defined six actions that specifically meet the needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people within the National Safety and Quality Health Service Standards (NSQHS), by actively supporting the elimination of racial discrimination and institutional racism; supporting increased access to health care; influencing the social, cultural and economic determinants of health; supporting the delivery of sustainable, culturally safe and responsive health services;¬† and recognise the importance of working with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, communities and organisations to design, deliver, monitor and review the health and support services we provide.

Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged and welcomed.

Metro North Health is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. We offer unique and rewarding professional development opportunities in a safe and flexible work environment with a focus on putting our people first. You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Metro North here: https://metronorth.health.qld.gov.au/careers

Ad Text:
Help us deliver like never before‚ÄØ
Australia Post is delivering like never before. From the vehicles that we drive, to the small businesses that make our communities thrive. We‚Äôre delivering for the environment, for our communities, for our customers and our people. We‚Äôre moving forward and we want you to come along for the ride.‚ÄØ



About the opportunity‚ÄØ
¬†As a Network Analyst, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in enhancing the performance of Australia Post‚Äôs end-to-end network. Focusing on network flow analysis and optimisation, you‚Äôll collate and interpret data on volumes, asset capacity, and network flows to identify opportunities for redesign that meet capacity demands while optimising service and cost.

This role is central to evaluating, modelling, and optimising our network to determine the most efficient, cost-effective paths, fully leveraging our facilities, processing capacity, fleet, and infrastructure. The ideal candidate thrives on complex data, turning insights into actionable recommendations that drive both strategic and operational decision-making.


What you‚Äôll deliver with us‚ÄØ

In this role, you‚Äôll turn complex network data into actionable insights that optimise Australia Post‚Äôs end-to-end operations. You‚Äôll identify efficiencies, assess trade-offs, and design network solutions that balance cost, service, and operational feasibility ‚Äî helping us deliver smarter, faster, and more cost-effective outcomes.

Analyse network performance, flows, and capacity to uncover optimisation opportunities and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
Determine lowest cost-to-serve paths using existing assets, leveraging analytics and simulation tools to inform strategic recommendations.
Build robust business cases and metrics to measure the impact of network changes on cost, service, safety, and sustainability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior leaders, acting as a subject matter expert to support data-driven operational and strategic decisions.

About you‚ÄØ ¬†

You‚Äôre an analytical thinker with a passion for optimising complex networks. With experience in supply chain, logistics, or network analysis, you can turn large, complex data sets into actionable insights that improve cost, service, and operational efficiency.

3+ years‚Äô experience in supply chain network analysis, logistics optimisation, or related analytical roles, with transport network design and facility modelling highly regarded.
Skilled in SQL, Excel, and data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau), with experience in modelling or statistical tools (Llamasoft, AnyLogistix, R, Python) a plus.
Strong understanding of routing, transportation modes, fleet management, and facility operations, with exceptional problem-solving and attention to detail.



How we‚Äôll deliver for you

Join one of the most culturally and linguistically diverse workforces in Australia, with people of all ages, genders and walks of life
We deliver on our values of Trust, Inclusivity, Empowerment and Safety every day. They‚Äôre the TIES that bind our team together
Immerse yourself in the AP Way ‚Äì where every single team member partakes in a learning module to help understand the vital role we play in delivering on our strategy and purpose

¬†

We're delivering together

At Australia Post, we acknowledge the Traditional‚ÄØCustodians of the land on which we operate, live and gather as employees.¬†

We believe our business should reflect the diverse communities we operate in and are proud to be an inclusive workplace for people from all walks of life. We encourage applications‚ÄØfrom people of all ages, genders and backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, People with Disability, LGBTQIA+ and Refugees. We are one of the largest organisations in Australia to successfully achieve Disability Confident Recruiter status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process and workplace for those living with a disability and are committed to reviewing and removing bias in our processes to create a gender-equitable recruitment experience and workplace. ¬†If you have any questions about accessibility, please contact our Diversity & Inclusion team on inclusivecareers@auspost.com.au

Ad Text:

Strong skills in stakeholder engagement, process modelling, and workshop facilitation.

Ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions with clarity and confidence.
Expertise in preparing high-quality technical and business artefacts.
Familiarity with Agile, Scrum, Kanban, and hybrid delivery approaches.
Bonus points for Salesforce experience, CBAP (or equivalent), and higher education sector knowledge.

How will you make an impact?

Are you passionate about making a positive impact to our members dignified retirement?

As the Responsible Investments ‚Äì Senior Analyst (Stewardship), you will lead the execution of Hostplus‚Äô active ownership strategy, ensuring that stewardship activities, including proxy voting, company engagement, and ESG advocacy under the strategic direction of the Head of Responsible Investments.¬†These stewardship activities are critical to ensuring alignment with the Members‚Äô Best Financial Interests Duty, influencing corporate behaviour, promoting sustainable financial systems that support long-term value creation, and the protection of members‚Äô retirement outcomes.

The opportunity

As the Responsible Investments ‚Äì Senior Analyst (Stewardship), you will lead and enhance Hostplus‚Äô active ownership program, including proxy voting analysis and execution, company engagement, and ESG advocacy. You will collaborate with policymakers, regulatory bodies, and industry groups to shape ESG-related regulations and standards, while drafting and managing submissions to government consultations on exposure drafts, regulatory proposals, and policy papers. The role also involves monitoring and analysing ESG issues across the portfolio to identify engagement and advocacy opportunities, maintaining and improving voting and engagement platform analytics, and participating in collaborative initiatives.

You will develop and maintain comprehensive stewardship documentation, including engagement outcomes, proxy voting rationales, and performance tracking to support continuous improvement. Additionally, you will integrate stewardship insights into investment decision-making, contribute to ESG disclosures such as the Modern Slavery Statement and climate-related financial disclosures, and assist in preparing board and committee papers, presentations, and detailed stewardship reports. Other ESG-related tasks and projects may also be undertaken as required.

About you

Minimum of 3-5 years direct experience in investment stewardship, or active ownership for a large investment portfolio, in an institutional investing or superannuation setting
Tertiary qualifications in Finance, Commerce, Law, Public Policy, Environmental Science, or a related discipline.
Direct experience in developing, implementing and managing investment stewardship processes, and practices, including measurement, monitoring, documentation and reporting.
Experienced in producing disclosures for key ESG disclosures, reporting frameworks and drafting policy/regulatory submissions.
Experience with stewardship tools, ESG platforms and data visualisation platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) for ESG data analysis is highly desirable.
Proficiency in using all functions within a proxy voting platform such as Glass Lewis or Hermes EOS is essential.
Experienced in producing investment committee and/or board reports.

What can we offer you?

Our employees are passionate about what we do and are proud to be part of an organisation which helps everyday Australians achieve a brighter future. We value diversity of thought and have an open and flexible workplace. Some industry leading benefits we offer include:

Hybrid and flexible work environment
15% superannuation
Additional paid leave over Christmas and New Year
Additional 5 days paid ‚Äúflex leave‚Äù, so that you can take time out when you need it
18 weeks paid parental leave
Total Wellness Program, including benefits such as free flu shots, comprehensive EAP support, access to medical experts and wellness related events throughout the year
3 days community service leave
4 weeks paid gender affirmation leave
Access to long service leave at 5 years
Access to subsidised financial advice
Dedicated per person development budget to support your growth

Just to name a few!

About us

At Hostplus, we passionately provide around 1.8 million members with the best possible service; constantly looking for new ways to deliver better value while helping members get the most out of their super. We are inspired to help our members achieve greater security for their future and ensure they retire with dignity.

Your role at Hostplus will make a difference, whether you're in marketing, financial advice, operations or any of our other divisions - you'll be contributing to ensuring our members retire with the best possible outcomes, and what better feeling is there than knowing your role helps someone to retire with dignity and security?

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and appreciated for being their authentic selves. We celebrate diversity and believe that different backgrounds and experiences enrich our relationships and bring meaningful benefits to our people, our members, and the communities we serve.

We welcome applications from everyone and if you require any adjustments made during the recruitment process, we encourage you to reach out to us at talent@hostplus.com.au and to let us know how we can support.

How do I apply?

If you are interested in this opportunity, please follow the prompts to make an application.

We have an important duty to our members, all appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police, Bankruptcy and Insolvency Check.
